channel.title: Making a computer realize java is there(help please)
channel.description: I'm running windows vista, I think i've downloaded java...maybe 34 times in the past 3 days. I've also downloaded Jdk6 u10 and Jdk 6 u7, yet my computer doesn't seem to realize the java is there. I've even called "FIRE DOG" , cheap rip off of Geek Squad, about it. Supposedly it should work. I am not or no where near dumb enough to do all of these things and not change what java im using for a 508. I've added classpath, javac, and the path codes in that doesn't work. Since i've have this pile for only 3 days i decided to restart it to an earlier date. I tried with no classpath, javac, and path codes in Enviroment variables. Any idea what's going on?

item.title: Making a computer realize java is there(help please)
item.dc:creator: @Scully Scully
item.description:
@Scully wrote:

your computer doesnt recognize java for what? a compiler or something?

if you have the lates version of java and the correct classpath you may need to get your computer updated or fixed or something if it still doesnt recognize it


It doesnt recognize it when i click the runserver.bat and when i use the compiler it tells me i don’t have java installed, but trust me downloading it 10 times and having it tell me “do you want to replace this” tells me its installed.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: October 21, 2008, 10:09:29 pm[/size][hr]Can you please not give me a joke answer because i seriously need help here

Read full topic
item.source: Making a computer realize java is there(help please)
